item.title: Isolation facility sa Pangasinan, tinangka raw sunugin ng isang COVID-19 patient
item.description: Inabutang nagliliyab ang lamesa sa loob ng isang kuwarto ng isolation facility sa San Manuel, Pangasinan matapos umanong sunugin ng isang 85-anyos na pasyenteng positibo sa COVID-19 na hindi pinayagan na makalabas.

item.title: Woman grabs Italian politician, rips shirt, breaks rosary
item.description: A woman grabbed hold of Italian politician Matteo Salvini on Wednesday as he campaigned for his anti-immigrant League party in the central region of Tuscany, tearing his shirt and ripping two rosaries from his neck.

item.title: Asia summits underway amid US-China friction
item.description: Southeast Asian foreign ministers kicked off a series of regional summits on Wednesday expected to seek collaboration to fight global threats, and to try to de-escalate a tit-for-tat rivalry as the world's two biggest economies vie for influence.

item.title: Two kidnapped from Dutch ship off the coast of Nigeria
item.description: Pirates attacked a ship on Tuesday off the coast of Nigeria and kidnapped two employees, its Dutch operators said.

item.title: Tondo residents use piso WiFi vending machines to attend online classes
item.description: Several residents in Baseco Compound in Tondo, Manila use a piso WiFi vending machine to attend online classes as the country transitions to blended learning amid the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic.

item.title: Piso wi-fi vendo machines, nagsasalba sa ilang taga-Tondo para makadalo sa online class
item.description: xxNakahanap ng murang paraan upang makasagap ng WiFi connection ang ilang residente sa Baseco Compound sa Tondo, Manila upang makadalo sa online class ang mga estudyante o maging ang ibang tao na kailangang mag-internet.

item.title: SWS: Two of five Filipinos see bleaker economy in next 12 months
item.description: Two out of five adult Filipinos or 40% expect the Philippine economy to worsen in the next 12 months, the results of a recent Social Weather Stations (SWS) survey showed.

item.title: Unlimited dialysis treatment through Philhealth to end after Sept. 15
item.description: Patients will no longer be able to avail of unlimited dialysis treatment through Philhealth after September 15, once the six-month declaration of state of calamity over the country is lifted amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.

item.title: Alkalde ng San Antonio, Nueva Ecija, nakaligtas sa ambush
item.description: Masuwerteng nakaligtas sa pananambang ng mga salaring nakamotorsiklo si San Antonio, Nueva Ecija Mayor Arvin Salonga.

item.title: 80% of Pinoy seniors have no retirement fund --BSP
item.description: Eighty percent of the 7.6 million Filipinos aged 60 and up do not have a retirement fund, the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) said.

item.title: Norway right-wing MP again nominates Trump for Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: A member of the right-wing, anti-immigration Progress Party, Christian Tybring-Gjedde had nominated Trump for the Nobel in 2018 for his rapprochement with North Korea, now in limbo.

item.title: 52 more PNP personnel test positive for COVID-19
item.description: The number of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases within the Philippine National Police (PNP) rose to 4,837 on Wednesday after 52 more personnel tested positive for the illness.

item.title: San Antonio, Nueva Ecija mayor survives ambush
item.description: San Antonio mayor Arvin Salonga survived an attack by gunmen while driving along a bridge in Jaen, Nueva Ecija on Wednesday.

item.title: Philippines seen to produce 16.6M metric tons of garbage by end-2020
item.description: The Philippines is projected to generate 16.6 million metric tons (MT) of trash by the end of 2020, according to Mark Salazar s report on “24 Oras.”

item.title: Over 300 NGOs urge UN to probe China rights abuses
item.description: The June statement had highlighted rights violations in Hong Kong, Tibet and against the majority-Muslim Uighurs in Xinjiang, as well as suppression of vital information in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, and attacks on rights defenders, journalists, lawyers and government critics across the country.
